name: vaguely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not clearly expressed, known, described, or decided: I vaguely remembered having met her before. He had thought only vaguely about a managerial future at that point.
without giving many details or facts, especially because you do not want to tell someone everything that you know: "We have our sources," Miguel replied vaguely. I was asked a few cursory questions about my job, which I answered as vaguely as possible.
to some degree or to a slight degree: You are probably vaguely health-conscious. I put the ornaments vaguely back into position. See
